psalm.text:
[[Ps 40,2]]I have waited, waited for the LORD, 
and he stooped toward me and heard my cry.
[[Ps 40,4a]]And he put a new song into my mouth,
[[Ps 40,4b]]a hymn to our God.

[[Ps 40,7]]Sacrifice or oblation you wished not, 
but ears open to obedience you gave me. 
Burnt offerings or sin-offerings you sought not;
[[Ps 40,8a]]then said I, “Behold I come.”

[[Ps 40,8b]]“In the written scroll it is prescribed for me,
[[Ps 40,9]]To do your will, O my God, is my delight, 
and your law is within my heart!”

[[Ps 40,10]]I announced your justice in the vast assembly; 
I did not restrain my lips, as you, O LORD, know.
psalm.title: Psalms

first_reading.text:
[[1_S 3,3b]]Samuel was sleeping in the temple of the LORD where the ark of God was.
[[1_S 3,4]]The LORD called to Samuel, who answered, "Here I am."
[[1_S 3,5]]He ran to Eli and said, "Here I am. You called me." "I did not call you," Eli said. "Go back to sleep." So he went back to sleep.
[[1_S 3,6]]Again the LORD called Samuel, who rose and went to Eli. "Here I am," he said. "You called me." But he answered, "I did not call you, my son. Go back to sleep."
[[1_S 3,7]]At that time Samuel was not familiar with the LORD, because the LORD had not revealed anything to him as yet.
[[1_S 3,8]]The LORD called Samuel again, for the third time. Getting up and going to Eli, he said, "Here I am. You called me." Then Eli understood that the LORD was calling the youth.
[[1_S 3,9]]So he said to Samuel, "Go to sleep, and if you are called, reply, 'Speak, LORD, for your servant is listening.'" When Samuel went to sleep in his place,
[[1_S 3,10]]the LORD came and revealed his presence, calling out as before, "Samuel, Samuel!" Samuel answered, "Speak, for your servant is listening."
[[1_S 3,19]]Samuel grew up, and the LORD was with him, not permitting any word of his to be without effect.
first_reading.title: 1st book of Samuel

second_reading.text:
[[1_Co 6,13c]]Brothers and sisters: The body is not for immorality, but for the Lord, and the Lord is for the body;
[[1_Co 6,14]]God raised the Lord and will also raise us by his power.
[[1_Co 6,15a]]Do you not know that your bodies are members of Christ? Shall I then take Christ's members and make them the members of a prostitute? Of course not!
[[1_Co 6,17]]But whoever is joined to the Lord becomes one spirit with him.
[[1_Co 6,18]]Avoid immorality. Every other sin a person commits is outside the body, but the immoral person sins against his own body.
[[1_Co 6,19]]Do you not know that your body is a temple of the holy Spirit within you, whom you have from God, and that you are not your own?
[[1_Co 6,20]]For you have been purchased at a price. Therefore, glorify God in your body.
second_reading.title: First Letter to the Corinthians

gospel.text:
[[Jn 1,35]]John was standing with two of his disciples,
[[Jn 1,36]]and as he watched Jesus walk by, he said, "Behold, the Lamb of God."
[[Jn 1,37]]The two disciples heard what he said and followed Jesus.
[[Jn 1,38]]Jesus turned and saw them following him and said to them, "What are you looking for?" They said to him, "Rabbi" (which translated means Teacher), "where are you staying?"
[[Jn 1,39]]He said to them,"Come, and you will see." So they went and saw where he was staying, and they stayed with him that day. It was about four in the afternoon.
[[Jn 1,40]]Andrew, the brother of Simon Peter, was one of the two who heard John and followed Jesus.
[[Jn 1,41]]He first found his own brother Simon and told him, "We have found the Messiah" (which is translated Anointed).
[[Jn 1,42]]Then he brought him to Jesus. Jesus looked at him and said, "You are Simon the son of John; you will be called Kephas" (which is translated Peter).
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint John
